Description: Lower body and conical foot sherd of large Chian Wild Goat Style pottery chalice; white slip; interior: glazed streaky brown (very worn); two bands in added white; exterior, glazed fired red-brown; on bowl, rays above by narrow and wide bands; lowest wall and outside of foot glazed with two white bands; on reserved underside some accidental slip.
Curator's comments: The hole in the bottom of the bowl may have been intentional and done in order to render the chalice useless.
Bibliographic references: Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GD.0065) (phase 2)
